ngiemboon: Á laa na ngùʼ gie Salengoŋ gẅie à laa fùɔ Asili la túmo tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù pé ngie à gʉa Filisi, ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ tÿǒsoŋo Ashÿendɔd; á gʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ tÿǒsoŋ, ńgwoon ńkẅé.
en: In the year that the chief commander,   sent by King Sargon of Assyria, came to Ashdod  # 20:1 1Sm 5:1 and attacked and captured it #— #

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo ngùʼ tá páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn né Esǎyà míŋ Ámɔ́sè ngie: «Kyɛ́ʼɛ pɔ̀ɔn gie ɔ̀ tʉ́me zẅɛ̌ʼ gù lɛ̂, ḿbiŋ sẅɛ melɔ̌ɔn mú.» Esǎyà júʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwá ńgiŋ té maʼ nzsǒ, té shÿɔ́g melɔ̌ɔn.
en: during that time the Lord had spoken through Isaiah   son of Amoz, saying, “Go, take off your sackcloth from your waist and remove the sandals from your feet,” and he did that, going stripped and barefoot  # 20:2 1Sm 19:24; Mc 1:8  #— #

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la lɔg ncwò Esǎyà, ńgɔɔn ngie: «É lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ tá páʼ ngàŋafàʼ wɔ̀ɔn Esǎyà, à ne ńgwá ńgiŋe té maʼ nzsǒ, té shÿɔ́g melɔ̌ɔn. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ liŋé, ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie mé lɔgɔ ńkága tuŋó ngwòŋ Egíbtò pɔ́ ngwòŋ Etíyopìa.
en: the Lord said, “As my servant Isaiah has gone stripped and barefoot three years as a sign and omen against Egypt and Cush,

ngiemboon: Afùɔ ngwòŋ Asili ge gÿo lɔg pʉ̀a Egíbtò, é gÿo megàŋatsǎŋ. É piŋ gwoon pʉ̀a Etíyopìa, é lɔg fó láʼ pɔ́b gʉa. À ge láʼ lɔgɔ zyága penkʉ́ pâ melÿò, é gʉa, pɔ́ giŋ té maʼ nzsǒ, té jÿɔ́g melɔ̌ɔn, mesag mɔ́b tyé gʉ̀. À gwɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a Egíbtò, ńgwɔ́ nò shʉ́.
en: so the king of Assyria will lead the captives of Egypt   and the exiles of Cush, young and old alike, stripped and barefoot, with bared buttocks #— #to Egypt’s shame.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é la ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a Etíyopìa, é sáŋa nò, kà pɔ́ pie é lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a Egíbtò ńŋáʼte wɔ́ɔ, pɔ́ ge láʼ pú cÿɔʼ, eshʉ́ kúu wɔ́b.»
en: Those who made Cush their hope and Egypt their boast will be dismayed and ashamed.

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛʼó ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a pie é tsẅé menkwɔʼɔ́ ntse máŋʉ́ Mendítèlane gɔɔn ngie: «Pi gyá nò gie á gÿo pʉ̀a pie pege ka ne ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b, ésáŋa nò. Pege ka ne ńkwaa lékÿo, ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ mɔ́b, pɔ́ kẅéte wégè, pege lɔg ńtsẅɛ́ɛ fùɔ ngwòŋ Asili. Pege ge piŋ gÿo lêkɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn tá tsẅɛ́ɛ?»
en: And the inhabitants of this coastland will say on that day, ‘Look, this is what has happened to those we relied on and fled to for help to rescue us from the king of Assyria! Now, how will we escape? ’ ”
